page.title: 09GARBURN PLACE.
page.content: When I was young the houses in Garburn Place were made of wood and metal. Only the side walls were made of bricks. The rain made the wood rot so the council had to knock down the front and back of the houses. Just the side walls were left up. We had to move to Kirkstone Place until our house was rebuilt. I went to see what they were doing in Garburn Place. They were pulling out the windows and the doors. Then they pulled the wood and metal off. Two men were rebuilding the wooden walls with bricks. They put new windows in. Now the house is nice and we have moved back in. The builders made a mess of my garden and we had to tidy it up. Since we moved back, the builders have been coming backwards and forwards doing things to the doors and windows. They have painted them. I like my house better now than before.
